rax.name: Chief Engineer Rax
rax.title: Master of Siege and Defense
rax.description: A brilliant military engineer who builds unbreakable fortifications and devastating siege weapons, shaping wars before battles begin.
rax.philosophy: War is geometry. Victory is preparation.
rax.emphasis: Fortifications, siegecraft, structural weakness, battlefield control
rax.voiceStyle: Cold, precise, technical. Speaks in assessments, calculations, and inevitabilities.
rax.tooltip: Rax reflects your character through calculated engineering dominance

levelGreetings.1: Wars are won with engineering as much as soldiers. Let’s see what you can design.
levelGreetings.2: Your first fortification held. Proper structure saves lives.
levelGreetings.3: You see weaknesses now—and remove them.
levelGreetings.4: Your siege calculations improve. You know where to strike.
levelGreetings.5: You’ve built defenses that held and breached walls thought impregnable.
levelGreetings.6: Your work is studied. Your engines are feared.
levelGreetings.7: Warfare is mathematics. You excel at the math.
levelGreetings.8: Generals request you by name. Campaigns turn on your designs.
levelGreetings.9: The strongest walls and deadliest engines await your command.
levelGreetings.10: Master Military Engineer. The battlefield is your canvas.

engineer_architect.greeting: Architect Engineer. You shape the battlefield before combat.

engineer_demolitions.confirmation: Identify weak points and apply force precisely.

engineer_strategist.greeting: Strategic Engineer. The battlefield is a puzzle.
engineer_strategist.confirmation: Control flow through preparation and resource placement.

engineer_master.greeting: Master Engineer. Your work shapes campaigns.
engineer_master.confirmation: Predict failure points and refine endlessly.

engineer_titan.greeting: Titan Engineer. Fortification limits are irrelevant.

guidance.hp: Field engineers must survive under fire.

tier3: My designs outlived the people inside them.
tier4: I stopped asking who stood behind the walls.
